fields.description:
When resetting a CA on the profile page it says the user will be asked to log in again when the password is updated. However, it does not log the user out after it.

!image-2019-05-27-11-36-12-068.png|width=375,height=245!

Steps for reproduction:
# Log into a service desk as a customer
# On the servicedesk portal go to the profile page and click reset password
# Reset your password and click save.

Expected behavior:
The user is logged out and is asked to log in again.

Current behavior:
The user is not logged out and can still use JSD.
fields.summary: User is not logged out after reseting password of a customer account

fields.description:
Approvals are now available in next-gen projects. You can now add approvals in your workflows, assign approvers and transition workflows automatically when the request is approved or rejected!

We’d love for you to check it out, add approvals to your workflows and let us know what you think.
 * To set one up, head to Project settings > Request types, and click the Edit workflow button at the top.

 * Select a status, and in the sidebar on the right hand side you should see an Approvals section, where you can add a new approval to that status.

For more detailed info on how to set up approvals, please check out our [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/add-an-approval-to-a-request-type-in-next-gen-projects/].

If you have any questions or feedback, please feel free to reach out,

Cheers

The Jira Service Desk team
h3. ------
h3. Problem

Currently, it is not possible to configure approvers in next-gen projects, only in classic ones. This is a major functionality to customers that wants a simple configuration with approvers.
h3. Suggestion

Enable approvers in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Enable the approvers on next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * Currently, only "site-admins" group members are able to manage(edit, delete) portal-only customer accounts

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow project administrators to delete/edit portal-only accounts(scoped to customers of that particular project)
 * Does complicate things if customers are members of multiple projects, but we do need a way to allow customer account management without having to give someone full "site-admin" permissions

h3. Why this is important
 * Giving someone "site-admins" to manage customers for a particular project is not always practical as the existing "site-admins" members might not want the project administrator to be able to see/change the billing settings or the licensed accounts
 * Site admins on Jira aren't necessarily the ones who would know the customers.  Creates an extra step for Jira/project administrators who need to manage their customer base

h3. Workaround
 * Give that person "site-admins" group membership keeping in mind that they would have the highest permission level possible
fields.summary: Allow project level adminstrators to manage customer accounts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some fields are not translated to German and also there's fields translated with mix english and german , which is not good. 

The fields not translated are :-
# Assignee
# Request Type
# Organization
# Label
# Request Participants
# Approvers
# Impact
# Urgency
# Pending Reason

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open new issue view ticket
# Change Deutsch language in Profile .
# View again the ticket

h3. Expected Results
All fields translated to German (Deutsch)
h3. Actual Results
Fields not translated to German :-
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 4.34.14 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 4.34.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Fields not translated to German Language (Deutsch)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 24 October 2019}
The "create sub-tasks" buttons are now available in the new issue view for Jira Service Desk projects.
{panel}
h2. Problem Definition

The new issue view in Jira Software includes the a button to create a sub-task and the old issue view for Jira Service Desk includes the *Create sub-task* option in the ellipses menu.

Neither of these are available in the new issue view in Jira Service Desk.

Current Jira Software (new issue view):
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 09.30.04.png|thumbnail!

Current Jira Service Desk (old issue view):
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 09.30.27.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Include the create sub-task button in the Jira Service Desk new issue view.
h3. Workaround

Switch to the old issue view to access the *Create sub-task* option in the ellipses menu
fields.summary: Include button to create sub-task in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Service Desk Project's customer page will timeout when the project is "open" to anyone, and there are a large number of accounts (~40k) registered on the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Jira Service Desk instance with about 40k+ user accounts registered
# Create an SD project and set the "Who can raise requests" customer permission to "Anyone with an account".
# Load the Customer page o the SD project.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads successfully

h3. Actual Results

The page will not load any customer and will remain blank.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

The bug should happen regardless if the user accounts are inactive.
fields.summary: Customer page times out when there are a large number of accounts on the site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently there isn't a way to send emails to customers based on a mailing list, so not possible to send information to customers in a newsletter type format and cadence
* Related suggestion ticket: [JRACLOUD-70298|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70298]

h3. Suggested Solution
* Implement [CONFCLOUD-5643|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5643]
* Allow portal-only accounts to be part of that mailing list
* Work that feature into the Jira Service Desk(JSD) knowledge base

h3. Why this is important
* Allows admins/agents to keep customers informed about the latest news and changes
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known practical workarounds
fields.summary: Leverage knowledge base(Confluence) to send mass emails to customers in the form of newsletters or similar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a request is created via email the "Request Participant" is added to the ticket right after it is created, however, in some cases, it may race condition with automation rules triggered by the issue creation event. In those cases, actions made by the automation may be reverted.


h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field and add a few options to it. This bug was replicated using a "check-box" field type.
# Make sure that the field is in the issue type/project context and screens.
# Create an automation rule that will run on the issue creation and automatically set the field value. Example:  
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue via email, CC'ing another customer.

h3. Expected Results

- The request participant is added.
- The automation rule is triggered and the field value is set.
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

- The automation will happen before the request participant is added to the ticket, and the field value will be cleared by the issue reported, even if they have no permission to edit the ticket.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes

- The intermittency is due to the order which the events happen (automation rule execution and participant being added to the ticket)
- Whenever the automation rule is executed *before* the CC is added, the bug will occur.
- The bug will not happen when the automation is triggered *after* the request participant is added to the ticket.
- The "Service Desk Widget" user was set as the default account for automation rules.
- We noticed that this affects other triggers as well such as *comment*.
fields.summary: Race condition between automation rules and adding a request participant via email

fields.description:
Hello,

 

I would like to have a report with the logged time spent between 1-30 of a month, what query/ filter should I use to have a correct report?

Thanks in advance,
fields.summary: Suggest for montly report

fields.description:
Hello,

 

we would like to integrate Jira with our telephony system so that it creates tickets automatically, is it possible to provide us an admin account with API access?

Thanks in advance,
fields.summary: Admin account for API access

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some Chrome users can face a local storage error (visible console), preventing them from viewing their tickets
{code}
From the console - is_arguments.js:12 DOMException: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of '/customerview/session' exceeded the quota.

 
Another one - Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of 'atlassian-analytics.unknown.lock' exceeded the quota.
{code}

Here's the screen that will be rendered:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Customer Impact
Customer unable to access customer portal tickets (should still be able to navigate / raise tickets, the problem is not being able to view them)

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
TBD at this point

h3. Expected Results
Portal user can view their ticket.

h3. Actual Results
Portal user runs into the above error and can't view their ticket

h3.Workaround
Clearing the local storage.
In the Developer Tools, click Application > Local Storage(sidebar) > Find the domain where the problem is experienced > Clear All (stop sign)
fields.summary: Chrome local storage error (in the console) when viewing a portal ticket, preventing accessing the ticket

fields.description: It'd be helpful to allow customers to follow the "Blog" section of the Space configured as the Service Desk project's Knowledge Base, and to send them a notification when a new blog post is created.
fields.summary: Allow customers to subscribe to the Blog page on the Space used as KB

fields.description:
Currently, Jira will only keep track of positive ("thumbs up") feedback on KB articles, on the "Requests deflected in portal" series in reports.

However, there's no tracking of negative ("thumbs down") feedback.

It'd be useful to display that feedback in order to provide better articles to customers.
fields.summary: Add a report to keep track of negative feedback on Knowledge Base articles

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Unable to configure Time Tracking for the Next-Gen Service Desk Project.

*Suggested Solution*

The feature should be included in the Next-Gen Projects.

*Why this is important*

Agents need to track their worklog using time tracking feature.
fields.summary: Time Tracking for Next-Gen JIRA Service Desk projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Summary" and "Description" field translated the same for Russian language , which is *описание*. This causing error at request type configuration page because the name are the same.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create next gen project
# Open Request Type configuration page 
# If view from English language , it show as below :-
 !Screenshot 2019-05-17 at 3.57.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Change to "Russian" language from user profile

h3. Expected Results
Summary translated to *резюме* , Description translated to *описание*

h3. Actual Results
Both translated to *описание*
 !Screenshot 2019-05-17 at 4.14.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use english language profile.
fields.summary: "Summary" and "Description" Russian translation are the same for next-gen template

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Service Desk project allows Priority field to be hidden. The value will be NULL. This will trigger the bug in "Create Linked Issue" feature wherein the target project, the Priority will be set to the highest in the sequence of available Priority, e.g. Critical.

Default value for Priority in Jira configuration will be ignored.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create two Projects, One should be Service Desk type.
# Make sure the Default Priority is "Low" from the priorities section
# Go to the Service Desk project and hide the Priority field from the Field configuration.
# Create a ticket in Service Desk project
# Click on "Create linked issue" button and create a ticket to the second project
# The priority will be set to the highest in sequence in that instance]


h3. Expected result
Default priority is set on the linked issue.

h3. Current result
Highest priority is set.
fields.summary: Priority is set to highest in the target project when "Create Linked Issue" is used

fields.description:
Hello,

 

we would like to integrate our telephony toot with Jira so that creates tickets automatically, is it possible to access API with our admin account or we need to request a separate access?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Admin account for API access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

KB article viewer page content truncated on right in portal view
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and publish a KB page in Confluence which contains a long URL
 # Load the KB page on an iOS device (reproduced on Safari and Chrome on iOS)

h3. Expected Results

KB loads fully without content being cut off
h3. Actual Results

Content is cut off from the right side
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: KB article viewer page content truncated on right in portal view when page has long URL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
This problem is born of [JSDCLOUD\-630: SSO integration with JIRA Service Desk|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-630]. 

We do currently have an internal endpoint which is called when resetting the customer password 
{code}https://admin.atlassian.com/gateway/api/adminhub/customer-directory/directory/{cloudId}/user/{aaid}{code}

However, this can only be run by copying the command from the browser dev-tools console to cURL. The drawback of this is the copied command is only valid for the life of that browser session.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an external endpoint for resetting JSD customer passwords to allow Jira Service Desk admins to have move options when managing customer accounts.
fields.summary: Create a public REST endpoint for resetting Jira Service Desk customer account passwords

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When email contains formatted signature , the email doesn't get stripped. The entire email added as comment. 
h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Add a mail channel to the project
# Create an issue through mail
# Trigger a notification to be send from JIRA towards the customer account
# The notification will contain the \{\{—Write replies above—}}. Write a reply above this line, and apply some color changes to the text in the mail

h3. Expected Results
The mail body gets added to the Service Desk request where only the text above the —Write replies above— gets added

h3. Actual Results
The whole body content will get added to the request, including the original notification content originating from Service Desk.

h3. Workaround
Removed the signature.
fields.summary: Strip quotes not working when email contains formatted signature

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The action button does not keep a consistent order

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an open ticket via Jira interface
# The action buttons are laid out as:
* Edit, Comment, Assign
# Now, access a closed ticket:
# The action buttons are laid out as:
* Edit, Assign, Comment

h3. Expected Results
Jira should keep the consistency on the layout

h3. Actual Results
The buttons change the order on which they are shown.

*Notes:*
This only happens on the automatic page refresh while closing the ticket inside a queue:
* https://URL_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/projects/PROJECT_KEY/queues/custom/QUEUE_ID/ISSUE_KEY

Open tickets:
!open.png|thumbnail!

Closed ones:
!closed.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The action button does not keep a consistent order

fields.description:
Hello,

 

would it be possible for Atlassian to incorporate sentiment analysis into their ticketing system that would scan already existing tickets and suggests possible duplicate/related tickets?

 

This would speed up ticket resolution time for support as it could find resolved tickets for the same or similar issues and also help developers allocate their time by knowing which issues and/or frustrations are experienced by a lot of customers and as such should be prioritized.

 

I understand that this wouldn't be an easy thing to incorporate but I imagine it would be an extremely useful feature to all of Atlassians client's.

 

What I’m imagining below would be shown on the right side of a ticket.

  !image-2019-05-15-07-58-15-192.png|width=407,height=634!

 

Best Regards,

Rhys Zippel

Deswik Support
fields.summary: Use Sentiment Analysis To Find Related Tickets/Issues

fields.description:
If an transition other than the ones defined on the approval step, the ticket is still shown as needing approval.

It'd be best to clear that to avoid confusion, as the workflow has already advanced through it.
fields.summary: Clear the need for approval when a third transition is executed instead of "Approve" or "Decline"

fields.description: Considering the order that activities display in the notification email are currently reversed from the way that they display in the portal when viewing a ticket – it would be nice to get the notification emails updated/fixed so that the display order in the email matches the portal.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure batched customer notifications order

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Knowledge base allows for related articles to be displayed in a panel on the full issue view
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 21.11.28.png|thumbnail!
 * Search queries using a colon ":" in the middle returns zero results e.g. "String1: string2"
 * If a colon is used in the middle of the query, then the whole query is invalid and zero results are returned
|!Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 15.40.16.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 15.40.39.png|thumbnail!|

 * If the title of an article has a colon in it, then the colon isn't highlighted when searching
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 21.13.49.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence article with a colon in the article title e.g. "My article: printer cleaning"
 # Navigate to an issue in the same project
 # See under "Related knowledge base articles" and click "Search knowledge base"
 # Try a search query such as
{noformat}
My article: printer
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
 * The article called "My article: printer cleaning" is found in the search results

h3. Actual Results
 * No articles are found

h3. Notes
* Using the above example, if one were to search "My article:", then the search would return results
* This bug also affects customer searches in the portal
 * The issue/request Summary is used as a search query to find related articles. The same applies - zero results of there is a colon in the middle of the search query.  See under "Related knowledge base articles"
|!Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 21.41.40.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 21.42.07.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 21.42.21.png|thumbnail!|

(Optional - If Necessary)

h3. Workaround
* Search will work as long as the colon is not in the middle
fields.summary: Knowledge base: the search query returns zero results when using a colon(:) in the middle of the query

fields.description:
We would like to have all of the assets owned by the submitter of a ticket to be automatically attached to that ticket. Right now the user can select an asset that is relevant to their ticket but this field cannot be hidden and auto filled. When selecting the default value, the screen looks like the image below. It appears that this may become a select box where specific assets can be selected. This would be nice, but even better would be to make the default value an IQL / JQL statement so that many dynamically selected assets can automatically be attached. Please let me know if the non functioning drop down associated with the assets field when hidden is a bug, what it will eventually be, and any timeline associated with those changes.

!image-2019-05-13-13-43-13-759.png!
fields.summary: Insight Assets Auto-Population

fields.description:
Currently, if the portal has many KB categories, the option to *raise a request* goes off the page and customers can't see that without scrolling. This may be confusing for some customers.

An option to bring *raise a request* option on the top would be better. Or, confine the *KB categories* in a scroll-able panel and show the option to *Raise a request* on below that panel so the customers can see that without scrolling.
fields.summary: Ability to re-order KB categories and raise a request link

fields.description:
In JIRA, the Google Analytics script can be added to the Announcement Banner in order to track visits/usage.

There does not seem to be an equivalent area for the JSD portal, so can something please be added to enable this?

The benefits of being able to track usage of the JIRA Service Desk portal are self-evident.
fields.summary: Provide ability to add Google Analytics script to JIRA Service Desk portal

fields.description:
Using a SLA calendar on the automation trigger, the Time in Status SLA could be used ignoring weekend conditions using actual working hours.

e.g.: a 24h "Time in status" trigger with a SLA calendar of 8h/day would actually take 3 working days to trigger.
fields.summary: Add ability to use SLA calendars on "Time in Status" automation triggers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Selecting the same date option on the JSD reports is not possible.


h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On JSD report, select "Custom date" option from the date drop down
# Select the same date on both "from" and "to"


h3. Expected Results

You should be able to update the search based on the selected date. Selecting other dates are possible:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The update button is greyed out:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Selecting the same date on the custom date option in JSD reports will grey out the update button

fields.description:
On this page: [https://osueesc.atlassian.net/projects/WS/customers]

We would like to be able to sort by open and closed requests.

It would helpful to easily see who has contacted us the most or least, so we can contact them about doing usability testing.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add ability to sort by number of open or closed requests

fields.description:
As a Project Lead for my company, I want to be able to add a Jira SD Macro to some of the pages within the Confluence space I created for my customer to provide them with status on existing tickets, and allow them to see the tickets that are rendered there to point to Service Desk tickets when my client does not have "Browse" permissions to view the project in its internal view.

Currently, the existing Jira filter can't even be used if my customers don't have Browse permissions, but even if they could it would only point to the internal tickets view, which I don't want my external clients to have access to. Otherwise, they'll be able to see Internal comments as well.

This feature request is for Atlassian to create a Service Desk Macro that can be utilized within Confluence that actually points to SD tickets (SD portal view of the ticket).
fields.summary: Create a Jira Filter Macro that Displays Service Desk Tickets on Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6325].
{panel}
Currently, approvals in workflows ignore conditions when transitioning to approved/not approved statuses.

For example, let's say the following workflow condition gets added to additionally filter list of approvers:

 !image-2019-04-15-11-37-13-373.png|thumbnail! 

This condition won't be evaluated against workflow transition and the button will still be visible for users who don't belong to the group.

This currently works as designed, but it would be beneficial to implement support for additional workflow condition so that the users can refine their approval steps and modify the process according to their needs.
fields.summary: Make approval step to respect workflow conditions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a KB article contains a video file, this will play fine in Confluence, but will not play back through the portal view of the customer but redirecting user to download it. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in a Confluence space that is linked as a KB
# Add a short video to the page using the Multimedia Macro
# View the article from the portal as a portal only user

h3. Expected Results
Video should play fine in both Confluence and Jira SD

h3. Actual Result
Clicking on the video download the file instead of previewing it. 

h3. Workaround 
Use Widget macro on Confluence page
fields.summary: Multimedia macro with a video doesn't allow preview in JSD portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Service desk customers are automatically added in the Project Settings --> People --> ServiceDesk Customer Role.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
* Create a new Service desk project
* Ask an external customer to raise a request via the portal
* Once the issue is raised by the customer, Go to the project --> Project settings --> People
* We can observe that the user is automatically added in the list, with the Service desk Customer Role.

h3. Expected result
Users should only be added in the *Customer* page of the project and not the *People* page.

h3. Why this is important 
This can be deemed as a security issue.
Also is not a pleasant customer experience.
fields.summary: Service desk customers are automatically added in the Project Settings --> People --> Servicedesk Customer Role

fields.description:
would be fine to be allowed to set SLA goal rule for time-to-resoultion by days as well.

 

I.e do we want to set a goal for minor/trivial  bug reports to a week or more
fields.summary: Ability to set SLA time goals by days

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a custom logo and banner in site A
# Export site A and import to another Cloud instance
# Check the Look and Feel setting of the migrated customer portal

h3. Expected Results
The logo and banner set at site A is inherited

h3. Actual Results
Logo and banner is broken
 !スクリーンショット 2019-05-08 15.19.01.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Upload the images again
fields.summary: In the new support portal, custom logo and banner breaks upon migration to another Cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The mail handler is now case sensitive and processing errors are happening when the customer email address does not match exactly how's in Jira database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a customer with a capital letter, eg: John.Smith@domain.com
 # Send a message to Service Desk email handler without capital letters, eg: john.smith@domain.com

h3. Expected Results

All messages should be processed. The system should change all letters to lowercase. 

h3. Actual Results 

Messages are processed as different customers. If public signup is disabled, messages will fail.
fields.summary: Mail handler is case sensitive for customer's email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding request participants to the ticket will result in errors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Add a Request participant and confirm.
# Edit the "Request participant" and try saving again.

h3. Expected Results
The field is successfully saved.

h3. Actual Results

The following error appears:
Could not find usernames: $user.name

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Clearing the Request participant and adding everyone at once seems to work.
fields.summary: Editing the Request participant field results in "Could not find usernames" error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inviting existing users as agents to a Service Desk project, an error *sd.agent.invite.team.email.address.agent* will be displayed which is not meaningful.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the *Invite team* of a project
# Invite an existing agent of the project

h3. Expected Results
An error that the user is already an agent is shown
h3. Actual Results
Error *sd.agent.invite.team.email.address.agent* is shown.

 !Screenshot 2019-05-06 at 10.49.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
The admin inviting the users would have to manually crosscheck existing agents to see if they are already available.
fields.summary: Inviting an existing agent to a project throws an unknown error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Loading page in iframe works in Confluence, but the iframe height seems to be always 40px when viewing Knowledge Base(KB) article
* When accessing the Confluence page using the Jira Service Desk(JSD) portal, pages within the iframe are narrow and are not readable:
||View from portal 
(e.g. https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/<article_id>)||View from Confluence||
|!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!|!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!|
* Changing the iframe macro settings in Confluence has no effect on the iframe height when loading the corresponding KB article:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Jira Service Desk Cloud
* Confluence Cloud
* Knowledge Base feature enabled in Jira Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that the Knowledge Base in JSD is configured as per [Set up a Knowledge Base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/set-up-a-knowledge-base-957150219.html]
# Create the Confluence page which contains an iframe macro
# Configure the iframe macro as required
# Load the corresponding Knowledge Base article within the portal

h3. Expected Results
* The iframe dimensions are correct as per the settings on the iframe macro in Confluence

h3. Actual Results
* The iframe when viewing KB article is too narrow and the page is not easily readable
 
h3. Notes
* When inspecting the iframe, the height always seems to be 40px despite the setting in the iframe macro in Confluence specifying that the value should be different:
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
* The "width" setting in the iframe macro settings seems to change the iframe width, but "height" doesn't seem to do anything

h3.Workaround
 # In Confluence, click on the iframe and click "Edit"
 # Set "Align" to the blank option at the top of the list.
 # Save/Publish the Confluence article.

 

Overall it should look like this once done:
 !CleanShot 2019-05-08 at 11.26.11@2x.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Loading page in iframe works in Confluence, but the page isn't displayed correctly when viewing the Knowledge Base(KB) article

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Spelling error on French translation at customer portal for 'Created by me' menu

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up your instance on French
# Then access the customer portal > *Requests*(Demandes in French)

h3. Expected Results
On the sub-menu that opens up, it should be spelled as:
{noformat}
Créées par moi (Created by me)
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Créé par moi
{noformat}
fields.summary: Spelling error on French translation at customer portal for 'Created by me' menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you accidentally click outside of the re-Captcha window you are not able to submit the ticket anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable login-free portal
 # Try to submit a request and expect the confirmation pop-up to show up
 # Once it does, click outside of the pop-up

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to try to submit the ticket once again.
h3. Actual Results

The fields and buttons are grayed out and you can't submit the request once again, unless you refresh the page.

!captcha.gif||width=507,height=346!
h3. Notes

You are able to copy(CTRL/CMD + C) the field value before reloading the page
fields.summary: If you accidentally click outside of the re-Captcha window you are not able to submit the ticket anymore
As a JSD user, I would like to have more supported JQL operators for Organizations field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When filtering the search by Request Participants field, it wouldn't let you find the user/participants 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to issue navigator
# Use the basic search
# Add the request participants field
# Try searching for user in the request participants field

h3. Expected Results
Able to search for users

h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
You can filter your search using Request Participants field via the advance search
fields.summary: Unable to filter the JQL search using Request Participant field

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update from Product team}
Hi everyone,

I'm one of the Product Managers on Jira Service Desk looking to improve our feature set around incoming email and solve some of the longstanding open issues. I'm currently trying to better understand the problems and various use cases so we can develop solutions that benefit all customers and prioritise them correctly. I'd love to reach out to you to better understand, not just the need for this feature, but also other issues around incoming email. If you would like to discuss your use cases and requirements further, please reach out to me at [jdcruz@atlassian.com.|mailto:at%C2%A0jdcruz@atlassian.com%C2%A0]

I'll provide updates on our roadmap soon once our team has triaged these issues. Thanks for your patience.

Cheers,
Jason
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Emails containing HTML tables that are nested (smaller tables within main table) nested  
For example will not be parsed correctly in the Description field of the issue: !image-2019-05-01-22-45-32-578.png|thumbnail! 
The nested tables will be added as rows to the main table causing the table to be malformed, for example:
 !image-2019-05-01-22-55-49-345.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed Solution
Improve HTML parsing for email in Jira service desk to support nested tables.
fields.summary: Improve HTML parsing for emails containing nested tables

fields.description:
Previously we could select the time we needed but the new Date Time Picker that shows in the portal only shows 30 minutes interval and we can't customize the minutes.
It would be great if the Date Time Picker has the same option as before.
fields.summary: Unable to customize the minutes when using Date Time Picker

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be useful to be able to pin documents to the widget similar to article categories in the portal so admins can list common documents for browsing by customers without having to search.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow articles to be 'pinned' to the widget to allow browsing without having to search

h3. Workaround
No known workaround - you must search to find articles
fields.summary: Pin KB articles to the JSD widget for browsing without having to search

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

If you're uploading a new banner for the Help Center and it's not in the recommended resolution it may not save the changes correctly.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

It would be good to have the recommended size of the banner and logo in the customize page of the Help Center.

h3. *Why this is important*

It's important to avoid a situation where the banner is not updated and the user doesn't know the reason.
fields.summary: Include the recommended size of the images when you're customizing the Help Center.

fields.description:
As a regular customer opening tickets.

I would like to see more relevant information on the list of tickets.

So I can quickly pick the tickets that interests me the most at the moment.

 

As an example, I would like to add a column with the date of the last comment. I allows to instantly see where I got an answer.
fields.summary: Customize fields in Customer's ticket list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you set your preferred language in Jira Service Desk to Dutch in your personal settings, the Assignee is called 'Ultvoerder'. However, this is a misspelling and should be 'Uitvoerder' instead.

This misspelling only occurs in the screen when you have opened a specific ticket - the issue view screen. However, when you open your general 'All open' queue, 'Uitvoerder' (Assignee) is correctly spelled. See the attached screenshots.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your preferred language to Dutch
# Notice on the issue view Assignee is translated as *Ultvoerder* - incorrect
# Notice on your queue column for example it is correctly translated as *Uitvoerder*

h3. Expected Results
The issue view translates correctly like the queue column name

h3. Actual Results
The issue view translation is incorrect.
U*l*tvoerder _should be_ U*i*tvoerder

 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Setting language to Dutch mistranslates 'Assignee' on the issue view screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer unable to search knowledge based article from Customer Portal eventhough the permission was open for any active user without confluence licence.

h3. Customer Impact
Customer unable to search KB from Customer Portal. If they have direct link , they can open it.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link JSD project with Confluence space.
# The permission , set to *Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customers.*
# Then , login customer portal as customer (without license)
# Try to search the KB

h3. Expected Results
Customer should be able to search the KB

h3. Actual Results
Customer unable to search the KB. Only agent can search for the KB.

From Console , there's error :-
{noformat}
Error: undefined missing confluence/api/navigator-context
{noformat}
 !Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 6.57.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Agent able to search the KB.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Customer unable to search Knowledge Based article from Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Share as comment" button not available for Atlassian Account Customers

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an application link between JIRA Service Desk and Confluence
# Set the Knowledge base settings under Service Desk with the following option:
## Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customers.
# Create a page named *Test*.
# Make sure that the page above it does not has any restrictions
# Create an issue on the project with the Summary named *Test* as well.

h3. Expected Results

Under the Related knowledge base articles, the "Share as comment" button should be available.

h3. Actual Results
The "Share as comment" button it's grayed out.
!permission.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround

Under the space, settings allow *Anonymous access* view.

*Notes:*
The users are able to look for articles in the Help Center anyway.
fields.summary: "Share as comment" button not available for Atlassian Account Customers

fields.description:
It seems that Organizations could be a very powerful tool in Jira ServiceDesk but it's lacking several fundamental features that could make it really work:
 # Allow on the customer record to show the organization. Right now when we search customer we have no idea if they actually have the organization tied to them. You have to search in two places. 
 # Allow to default an organization for a customer since you can have more than 1 organization per customer. This way when they submit via email or the portal a ticket it will populate an organization by default.
 # Have an admin setting to turn off allowing customers to NOT share with their organization. We have an issue where users see this in the portal and decide not to share it and we have to update them when coming in. Which is difficult because when you search for the customer it doesn't house the organization at their record (see #1).
 # Allow for Organizations to be shared across the Jira platform. We use Software and now have to create a separate field to capture the organization of our Reporter.
fields.summary: Organization Settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently there aren't any options for Jira Service Desk(JSD) admins. to customize the layout of the issue view that customers see in the portal

h3. Suggested Solution
* In the new Jira issue view, it's possible to change the layout and what fields are displayed in the issue view - the same thing can be implemented for the portal

h3. Why this is important
* Allows admins more flexibility as to how they would like information to be delivered/viewed by their customers
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Portal: Customize layout of issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After the new update on the Portal, 'Field help' texts which are longer than two lines now appear truncated, and the customer has an option to display the full text with the 'show more' link.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow more lines for the 'Field Help'
* Remove "Show more" from 'Field Help'
* Define the default behavior (expanded/collapsed)

h3. Why this is important
* Customer may miss the important information on field help.
** Take "Priority" as the example, admin would usually put the description of each priority on the Field Help and this definitely requires more than 2 lines.
fields.summary: Allow longer 'Field Help' on the portal

fields.description:
We would like to create an individual page in the portal. Unfortunately, there is currently no option in the customer-portal module to address a corresponding submodule type.

 

In addition, it should be possible to insert links in the button Requests.  !image-2019-04-24-13-35-53-941.png!
fields.summary: Modul Type page in Modul Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The number of tickets in the queue is not being displayed in Internet Explorer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open the Queues of a JSD project using Internet Explorer.
# Check and the number of tickets in the right part of the queue name will not be displayed.

h3. Expected Results

It should display the total of tickets as it does in other browsers. You can check this feature working on Google Chrome down below.

 !Chrome.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The total of tickets is not displayed in IE, as you can check at the following example. In the test, we used the *11.706* version of the *Internet Explorer 11*.

 !Internet Explorer.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You could use a different browser as a workaround for this situation.
fields.summary: The number of tickets in the queue is not being displayed in Internet Explorer.

fields.description: When creating requests using the API, you can't specify the Request Language and it will get the project default. However, when you're creating issues on behalf of your customers using the API, and there's a multilanguage project in place, it is desired to specify the users' language so they receive notifications in their language.
fields.summary: Service Desk API should support Request Language when creating requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The following error message contains some malrfomed characters:  !download (4).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Correction:

auszuf?hren = auszuführen
Ausf?hrung = Ausführung

h3. Actual Results

 !download (4).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Malformed characters in German (Deutsch) translation in service desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira/Jira Service Desk(JSD) only supports the "Content-Disposition" header value of "attachment".  This is a problem as some inbound emails form services or certain email clients such as monitoring services, phone systems, etc. may come into Jira with the "Content-Disposition" header value of "inline" or "voice-message".

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow support for all valid "Content-Disposition" header values.

h3. Why this is important
Jira is not adding any attachments to newly created tickets or presenting inline media within tickets.
 
h3. Workaround 
* Forward the original email to a "conventional" user mailbox which then forwards on to Jira - the aim is to change the "Content-Disposition" header value to "attachment"
* Try to change the "Content-Disposition" header on the original outbound email, some services may have options to configure the outbound email headers
fields.summary: Support for the "Content-Disposition" email header to have values other than "attachment"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user belongs to an organization and at the same time belongs to the Service Desk Team role, the user is not searchable in the Customer List unless searched in the specific organization

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an agent to an organization
# Add the same agent to the Service Desk Team role of the project
# Search for the agent in the Customer List

h3. Expected Results
The user is displayed when searched.
h3. Actual Results
The user is not displayed.
 
h3. Workaround
If the user is known to belong to an organization, searching inside the organization would yield a result.
fields.summary: Searching users with Service Desk Team role in the customer list is not displaying result

fields.description:
Currently I seem to only be able to have the widget icon on my page as you have designed it.
Is there any simple way to change it? We have a very specific design language for our page and to be frank, the service desk "chat" icon is ugly :D 

!image-2019-04-22-14-48-00-710.png!

Only options I have is to have a "?" or custom text.  Any way to upload our own icon?
fields.summary: Widget icon customisation
REST API /rest/servicedeskapi/latest/info to return platform type

fields.description:
Jira Service Desk was recently introduced and the same as Software next-gen, there are many features missing.

Many customers use resolution for reports and metrics, so it would be good if we have this option for next-gen the same as we have for classic projects.
fields.summary: Ability to add a resolution on tickets when using JSD next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you translate Service Desk statuses but the agent and the customer use different languages, the status name that is used on the customer notification, is the Agent one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a customer and an agent with different languages
# Translate your workflow statuses
# Transition the ticket to one of these statuses and verify the customer notification
# The status name in the notification will be translated to Agent's language and not customer language.

h3. Expected Results

Status names used in customer notification is customer language.

h3. Actual Results

Status name used in customer notification is agent language.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Translated status doesn't work in customer notifications

fields.description:
Could you show me how to turn off this warning (as attachment).

Thanks a lot.
fields.summary: Turn of warrning in JIRA Service desk

fields.description:
h3. Description

It would be nice to have a global setting for automation rules on Jira Service Desk. On those settings, we should be able to set on behalf of who the automation will be run by default.

* This would also, allow us to share the automations across different projects and keep easier to scale and maintain the automation rules among many service desk projects.
* At this time each new automation is set to run on behalf of the Project default, but it would be nice to have the option to set the _User who triggered the rule_ as the default one.
fields.summary: Implement Automation rules Global Settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Portal only customer has 5 failed login attempts his account gets blocked, and currently if the Site-admin set a new password for him it's not unlocking the account
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Portal-only customer
 # Execute 5 failed login attempts
 # You'll receive this error:
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-18 at 11.55.31.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to <yourjira>.atlassian.net/admin > Jira Service Desk > Portal only customer and reset apply a password for the user

h3. Expected Results

User is able to login using the new password that was set.
h3. Actual Results

Use is still receiving the error.
h3. Workaround

Ask you Portal only customer to use "Forgot your password?" option and reset the password.

If your customers don't have mailboxes with their accounts, then contact Atlassian support informing the affected user and the desired password for an internal fix.
fields.summary: Setting a password for a Portal only customer doesn't unlock a locked customer account

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* In "Customer notifications", "Public comment edited" is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Reporter creates an issue in JSD project and adds a comment
# Assignee edits the comment

h3. Expected Results
A customer notification will be sent, accorting to the "Customer notifications" setting

h3. Actual Results
Customer notification won't be sent
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Customer notification not sent when assignee edits reporter's comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we set the *Date Time Picker* default value to the current date, it will show fine in the JIRA issue create screen but in the Service desk portal it uses GMT timezone. Once the issue is created through the portal, it would not convert back to the user time zone but instead, it will remain with the time the default value has selected.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the _Default user time zone_ of the instance to i.e. GMT-5;
# Set the default value date in a Date Time Picker custom field to the current date.
# Go to the Service Desk portal and try to create an issue in the request type that has the date time picker field with the default value set as the current time.

h3. Expected Results
* Date time picker field shows the correct time

h3. Actual Results
* Date time picker field shows the time in GMT timezone

h3.Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: The default value in the date time picker field uses GMT instead of the user time zone in JIRA Service Desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Agents/admins don't have the option to be notified when a customer completes a satisfaction survey

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add a notification event in the notification scheme for survey completed

h3. Why this is important
* Allows admins to be more proactive in addressing/reviewing survey results
 
h3. Workaround
* Create a custom script/app that uses the {{jira:issue_updated}} [webhook|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/] event to listen for changes to the "Satisfaction" field and to trigger an alert via your mail provider - or similar workaround
* Use the third-party app [Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview](or similar app) to create a rule that listens for changes to the "Satisfaction" field and then if the conditions are met - send an email to predefined recipients.  Similar to what is shown here:
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-17 at 10.47.53.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Satisfaction(cSAT): Send notification to admins/agents when a customer completes a survey

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When configuring an automation rule, under the "If these match > issue matches", it is not possible to select the "Request Language" language field using the basic JQL mode, but changing to advanced mode works.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Automation Rules.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to a Service Desk project > Project Settings > Automation;
# Create an automation rule;
# Try to select the *Request Language* field under the "If these match > issue matches" on the basic JQL mode.

h3. Expected results

The field can be selected and a language can be chosen, like other fields.

h3. Actual result

An exclamation mark and the message "Request Language is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type" are shown and the field cannot be selected.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-15 at 15.27.08.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Change to the JQL advanced mode and search for the Request Language field.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-15 at 15.32.20.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-04-15 at 15.32.47.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-04-15 at 15.33.12.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to select "Request Language" on an automation rule using the basic JQL mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing an SLA goal, the calendar in use will always reset to the 24/7 default calendar automatically and without warning. This has the potential for an admin to update an SLA goal JQL and and not notice the SLA calendar has also changed as they may not expect it to change from its existing setting.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an SLA
# Switch focus between two different SLA goals or edit a goal. 
# Notice the calendar always resets back to the 24/7 calendar (default)

h3. Expected Results
The existing calendar should remain set

h3. Actual Results
Anytime you click in the goal JQL the calendar resets to 24/7 Calendar (default)
 
h3. Notes
Merely clicking in the goal JQL will not save the calendar, you still must hit update. But if just editing some JQL you may not expect the calendar to change and just not notice is has changed.

h3.Workaround
No technical workaround. Always confirm the calendar in use after updating SLA goals.
fields.summary: Editing an SLA goal resets the calendar in use to 24/7 automatically

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inline images added via email reply are not being rendered by Jira due to a backslash at the beginning of the line

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket in a Jira Service Desk project via portal or email.
# Wait for the "Issue Created" notification.
# Reply to the notification, adding an inline image.

h3. Expected Results

The image's thumbnail is added to the comment.

h3. Actual Results

The thumbnail is created with a backslash at the beginning, which prevents the image rendering.
 \!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
The thumbnail is rendered correctly when the image is attached during the issue creation (via email)

h3.Workaround
Add the image as an attachment instead of "inline"
fields.summary: Inline images added via email reply are not being rendered by Jira due to a backslash at the beginning of the line

fields.description:
When looking at a report, if you click on a data point, it filters the details list under the graph for just that data point.

 

I would like to be able to click on a series of the report, and have the whole report - graph and details list - be filtered to only show that series, for the original time period (e.g. last 7 days).

 

E.g. I have a report showing created tickets, with a series for each Status.  I would like to click on a single Status series in the report, to focus in on that status only.
fields.summary: Within a report, filter the report by a specific series

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When self-signup is enabled for Jira service desk, customers can sign up through the following link:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
They will receive a complete signup email. 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
The translation of this email in Dutch can be improved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change Jira language to Dutch (Netherlands)
# Enable self signup in Jira service desk
# Go to the portal and signup

h3. Expected Results
Header:  
Voltooi de inschrijving voor het <<project name>>

Body:
Bijna klaar! 
Volg onderstaande link om uw inschrijving op het <<project name>> af te ronden. Uit veiligheidsoverwegingen adviseren we u om deze link niet te delen met derden.


h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Correction of Dutch translation of the "Finish signing up" email for service desk portal signup

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Incorrect Dutch translation of the text in the portal:
"Need to raise a request? Contact us"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change Jira language to Dutch (Netherlands)
# Go to the service desk portal 


h3. Expected Results
The correct translation should be: "*Wilt u een melding maken? Neem dan contact met ons op*"

h3. Actual Results
Translation now is: "Moet je een melding maken? Neem dan contact met ons op."
fields.summary: Incorrect Dutch translation in service desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When self-signup is enabled for Jira service desk, customers can sign up through the following link: 
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
They will receive a complete signup email. This email cannot be customized.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow customization of this email, just like how the invitation email can be customized.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the complete signup email for customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer replies are not always being parsed correctly including a long Sparkpost or Sengrid link on every comment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer reply to a notification via email
# Notice a long link being included on every comment

h3. Expected Results
Only the comment is added to the ticket

h3. Actual Results
The comment and an extra link is being included
 
Example link:
{noformat}!http://atlassian-eu.et.e.sparkpost.com/q/jl9RoNCe8zhkT0jITK1uTA~/AAAAAQA/RgRea5E3PlcLYXRsYXNzaWFuZXVCCgAAt12KXMPaEOhSGWtyaXN0ZW4uZHJld2VzQHByZXFpbi5jb21YBAAAAAQ~!{noformat}
{noformat}!https://u4043402.ct.sendgrid.net/wf/open?upn=ij0nt-2FuhhPgdvfpnC9aHIgE8Du5k9x-2BbQBRASZYFD8XCJwCDwCYu5K8M6Bm5-2BLoBefrdTJw1N481O4r7wYnQ-2BpxwT9MQg5TLVKJFBCp1wewviTOxQ6T3Qin3-2BAmaZZLVZtArV2MnM0Vpk5t1XrMx-2BbGabdSlMxQBA0yfotWApZw3D6s1MGb5YpzrBv2cSvP6hOeDRXO1PrMf15pcvA1QBRb41IehvnzOmxcUUk22oM0tgM0Cdd1AJ9phgyg40x2SW-2BKGXVSKJf8OPiuRqTcoA20YdZRV-2F6zRbOc8pCfHQ2UmpVn1ST7ycKOWV1k-2FB-2FWl5NqNG68wvM0DKfEAXLNbJRvRdKrfFoYNEwd-2FKBf5RDiyztniK1uoo9Jl7bIT-2FMCOcjTWcvspk1WpK4lfT3bfi-2BDAdmkGYcGTDFKsQudIBWTM6RadeDLcXNfQrj0Z98f1g2zO4wfdI9-2BqyOzzruO18A-3D-3D!{noformat}

h3. Notes
I'm unable to replicate it myself but affected customers can reliably

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Customer replies are not always being parsed correctly including a long Sparkpost or Sengrid link on every comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Confluence space is linked as knowledge base to JIRA Service Desk, when the agents open a ticket in JSD queue, the KB articles under "Related knowledge base articles" section are locked out and the gents are not able to share it as a comment.

h3. Customer Impact
Agents are not able to share the KB articles as a comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Cloud instance with multiple products (e.g., Jira Software, Confluence and Jira Service Desk)
# Add a user with only site access, do not assign any product licenses. So, this user is treated as a customer in JSD projects.
 !Customer account with AA.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to a JSD project which is linked to a Confluence space as the KB, and add the user account created in Step 2 as the customer.
# Go to JSD project settings, make sure that KB viewing access is set to 'Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customers'.
 !KB Settings.png|thumbnail! 
# If everything is setup properly, you'll notice 'Any active user can view this space' in the KB space permissions in Confluence.
 !Space settings.png|thumbnail! 
# Login to the portal as the customer and create a support case. 

h3. Expected Results
Agents should be able to share *Related knowledge base articles* as a comment in the ticket.

h3. Actual Results
"Related knowledge base articles" are locked out  and the gents are not able to share as a comment.
bq. This article is restricted. Only people with permission can view it.

 !Related KB Articles.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Additional info
It is working fine when the ticket was raised by (i.e., reporter) a portal only customer who is not migrated to Atlassian account.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Related knowledge base articles appear as restricted / "Share as comment" button not available for Atlassian Account Customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* In the current portal view, when "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" is set to "Yes" - the first day of the week remains on Sunday

h3. Environment
* JSD Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" to "Yes" in {{<base_url>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa}}(Jira settings > System > Look and feel)
# Create a new request via the customer portal and set a value in a date/time picker

h3. Expected Results
* Monday is the first day of the week

h3. Actual Results
* Sunday remains the first day of the week
 
h3. Notes
* This is not an issue on the older portal
||Old portal||Current help center||
| !Screen Shot 2019-04-10 at 11.40.06.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2019-04-10 at 11.39.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Setting "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" to "Yes" has no effect on the date/time picker on the portal

fields.description:
We are investigating some problems about some areas of the JSD Cloud customer portal not being translated when using an other language than the default one. Known areas at this point:
* Help centre "Customize" button to open/close the admin sidebar
* Service desk (single portal) entire admin sidebar

This most likely isn't a recent regression and we'll aim at providing with a fix towards the end of the week.
fields.summary: Some areas of the JSD Cloud portal don't get translations in other languages than the default one

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* The request type description field text is cut off when viewing the description in the customer portal
* The request type description field supports a high number of characters
* The portal doesn't allow the description field to be expanded, but all the characters are displayed if there are multiple carriage returns(new lines)

||Request type description||Portal view||Create request view||
| !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! | !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! | !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 

||Request type description(new line)||Portal view||Create request view||
| !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! |  !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! |!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Set a smaller character limit on the request type description field - a limit that corresponds to what can be displayed
* Show all the characters in the request type

h3. Why this is important
* Customers can't read the entire description field and may miss critical information related to the request type
 
h3. Workaround 
* Shorten the request type description so that all the characters are displayed
fields.summary: Request type description field does not display in its entirety

fields.description:
h3. (!) This problem is intermittent

h3. Summary

Sometimes when opening the widget on Chrome, there is a scroll bar on the right side of the widget breaking the view.

h3. Environment

Google Chrome.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Embed the widget code to an HTML page;
# Opens the page on Chrome.

h3. Expected results

The widget should appear correctly.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-09 at 14.17.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The widget appears with a scroll bar on its right side.
!Screen Shot 2019-04-09 at 14.19.40.png|thumbnail! 
Here is a video of the problem:  [^Widget scroll bar.mov] 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Widget appears with a scroll bar on its right side on Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user with an expired session-cookie navigates to the JSD customer portal instead of being redirected to login they are presented with a 401 error page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an account for the customer portal that uses SSO.
# Login
# Manually edit the session-cookie to make it invalid.
# Reload the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
User is redirected to the login page.

h3. Actual Results 
User is taken to a 401 error page. 

h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary)
This could possibly affect non-SSO users.

h3. Workaround 
Clear browser cache and cookies then reload the page, this will direct the user to the correct login page.
fields.summary: SSO users trying to interact with the customer portal after session expiry presents a 401 page instead of redirecting users to a login page.

fields.description:
As an admin, I would like to change the interval on which Jira pulls emails from my mailbox. At this time Jira tries to pull emails each 1 minute and it would be nice to have an option to customize that, because some mail servers may block those requests which are done each minute.

*Suggestion:*
It would be nice to have an option to set intervals like 5, 10 and 15 min of delay for example.
fields.summary: Add the ability to customize the email pulling interval

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Queues do not update the status of tickets until a page refresh


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a JSD queue
# Open a ticket in a new tab
# Transition the ticket
# Return to your queue tab and notice the status will not update until a refresh

h3. Expected Results
The status is updated just like the standard refresh

h3. Actual Results
The previous status is displayed
 
h3. Notes
The queue appears to recognise the correct status as valid transitions are displayed if you click on the status from the queue. So it would seem just the display is not updating.

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page - which sort of defeats the purpose of queues
fields.summary: Queues do not update the status of tickets until a page refresh

fields.description: Allowing customers to respond to the CSAT survey from the portal/tickets would make it easier to find the survey, instead of having to search for it in their mailbox.
fields.summary: Allow customers to respond CSAT surveys within tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Incorrect values displayed with the new SLA rendering

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the default 24h calendar with a goal of 120h
# Create an issue
# Notice the strange rendering

h3. Expected Results
Anything  over 24hs is considered a day.


h3. Actual Results
SLA shows: 3d 35h within 4d 24h

 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: New SLA rendering does not calculate days correctly when using 24h calendar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Reporter and Request Type fields are having static field description on the portal.
Example: "What can we help you with" or "Raise this request on behalf of"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

However, the system translation could be confusing for other languages. 
Example:
代表他提出申請 (Raise this request on behalf of) sounds like "Represent him to raise the request"
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to translate the static fields, so it can be more user-friendly to the end users.

h3. Why this is important
* The system translation is confusing
* Allow admin to make the fields easier to understand based on their target clients
fields.summary: Ability to customize the field descriptions for "Reporter" and "Request Type" on Portal
Portal X not posting data for article deflectings reporting
Add the ability to send a custom payload in a webhook using Jira Service Desk automation on Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A customer is not able to add themselves as a request participant to a request while being able to add other users as request participants.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers to add themselves as request participant to a request
h3. Why this is important
Adding themselves as request participants would allow them to be notified on any updates on a particular request the customers are interested.
h3. Workaround
If the ticket is shared to them via an organization, click on the Get notifications to "opt-in" and receive updates on the request
fields.summary: Allow customers to add themselves as request participant to a request

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Open an automation rule in two separate tabs
 *  Edit that rule in both tab
 * Click save in the first tab
 * Click save in the second tab

Expected result: Validation error is displayed, saying: "Cannot save changes. <user display name> has made changes that clash with yours."

Actual: Cannot save automation rule, but there is no error.
fields.summary: Automation doesn't display validation error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Portal only customers can be granted permission via permission scheme via Single User option. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JSD cloud site
# Create a Service desk project and add UserA as customer (portal only)
# Create a Business Project
# Edit the permission scheme of the Business Project
# Try to grant Browse Project permission to Single User = UserA

h3. Expected Results

The permission settings should not present portal only customers as an option and the permission should not be possible to be granted

h3. Actual Results

Portal only customer can be granted with the project permission. 

 !portal.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes

The portal only user will not be able to enter Jira due to lack of application access but it is confusing to admins that they are presented with portal only customer options when editing permission schemes for Business or Software projects.
fields.summary: Portal only customers can be assigned or be granted permissions via permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:title=Case Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#f4a742|bgColor=#efd4b1}
h3. *Problem Statement*

Viewing an exported Excel CSV for Service Desk Issues containing *Portal Only Customer* will show the ID instead of Name
h3. *Steps to replicate*
 # Create a Service Desk Project and invite a Portal Only Customer on the Project
 # Customer to Raise a new Request and confirm that the reporter field is the same Portal Only Customer.
 # Go to Issue Navigator and search for the issue
 # Click on the Share filter result and Click on Export Excel CSV

*Expected Result*
 The Reporter column shows the correct name on Excel CSV Sheet

*Actual Result*
 !Screenshot 2019-04-02 at 3.42.04 PM.png|width=768,height=301!
h3. *Workaround*
 # Go to Site Administration page https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/
 # Click on Jira Service Desk > Portal Only Customer
 # Click on Customer's drop-down menu and migrate customer to Atlassian Account{panel}
fields.summary: Viewing an exported Excel CSV for Service Desk Issues containing Portal Only Customer will show the ID instead of Name

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Go to this URL in an anonymous tab: [https://sd-flux-capacitors.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/group/1/create/1]
 * Don't fill anything. Just press send.
 * Complete the recaptcha challenge correctly
 * Wait for 2 minutes
 * The message below will be displayed

!image-2019-04-02-13-04-32-509.png|width=784,height=133!

 

The problem happens when the recaptcha challenge is successful but the form validation fails. E.g: Required field was not informed

If the user takes two minutes to re-submit the form, something will trigger a new POST but without the g-recaptcha-response header.

 

Confirmed that it only happens when recaptcha is enable.
Confirmed that it does not block the user from resubmitting after two minutes.

In other words, the message is just wrongly displayed causing some confusion but users can still create requests.
fields.summary: Keeping a form open for 2 minutes after mandatory field validation message "Couldn't validate you're not a bot" is incorrectly displayed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the customer is allowed to search for request types or articles the only option given to them is a search bar which can sometimes be counterintuitive, the customer may not know what they are searching for and just want to submit a ticket.

h3. Suggested Solution
Below the searchbar add a contact us button, similar to in the portal below the knowledge base articles.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: When searching is enabled on the Widget a contact button should also be included to enable submitting without searching

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
To be able to transition a request, customers would need to log in to the portal and view their request and would not be able to transition directly from the portal
h3. Suggested Solution
Include transition buttons in the email notification directly
h3. Why this is important
This would allow customers to easily resolve or escalate their requests directly from the email instead of needing to access the customer portal
fields.summary: Include transition buttons in email notification
